DOC.detailed_description: Primary Objective : To assess efficacy safety early administration vitamin D3 ( cholecalciferol ) reduce mortality morbidity vitamin D deficient patient high risk ARDS mortality . Primary Hypothesis : Early administration vitamin D3 ( cholecalciferol ) improve all-cause , all-location mortality day 90 vitamin D deficient patient high risk ARDS mortality . Patients recruit EDs , hospital ward , operate room , ICUs acute care area PETAL Network Clinical Centers . Screening include test Vitamin D ( 25OHD ) level use either hospital 's clinical laboratory FDA-approved point-of-care device ( FastPack IP , Qualigen Inc ) . Patients screen vitamin D deficient ( < 20 ng/mL ) randomize . Half randomized patient receive early administration high-dose vitamin D3 half receive placebo ( orally via naso/orogastric tube ) . Vitamin D pleiotropic role regulate immune function maintain epithelial surface integrity .
